label: 契冲
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: (1640-1701) Buddhist scholar-priest [who provided a] powerful stimulus to [the] aesthetic perspective of national history.  A devotee of the Shingon sect, Keichū also studied at Itō Jinsai's school and used the method of ancient studies ot approach the life and writing of the patron saint and founder of Shingon, Kūkai...and to seek the spiritual resources of this great and celebrated saint (p. 617). [真言、伊藤仁斎、空海]
